refnamediv.refpurpose: This decribes the locationforecast handler to wdb2ts. It is part of the wdb2ts apache module.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
The locationforecast handler accept request on the form.
http://host/path/location?lat=10;lon=10;alt=100;from=2008-12-12T08:00:00Z
Where lat is the latitude, lon is the longitude, alt is the altitude and from is the start time for the forecast we want.
The result is returned as xml desribed with the schema at .

refsect1.title: Configuration
refsect1.para: This handler has a set of handler specific parameters. It also make use of both the querydef and paramdef sections of the metno-wdb2ts-conf.xml configuration file.

refsect2.title: Handler specific parameters
refsect2.para:
To specify an handle specific parameter the <actionparam> tag is used. The format of this tag is.
<actionparam id="key" value="key value" />
Where id attribute is the configuration parameter and the value attribute is the value given to parameter.

The <actionparam> has no support for key/value lists. To simulate key/value lists we follow a name pattern on id. Ex.
<actionparam id="parameter_name-key" value="listvalue" >
Thw hyphen is used to separate the parameter name from the key.
In the documantation this type of parameters is marked as key/value list.

listitem.para: This value associate providernames with placenames. The values is used to reproject vector fields.

The values is given as a ';' separated list of key/values on the form:
value="providername0=placename;providername1=placename1;providernameN=placenameN"
A list of placename is found by using the wci.placespecification function to the wdb database.
Key/value list.

Describe the meta information that goes into the output xml. The providername defines the provider this meta information is for. The output tag is on the form:
<model name="outname" nextrun="hh:mm" termin="hh" from="YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ" to="YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ" />
Where - outname is the name this dataset is known as. - nextrun is when the next dataset is expected to be available. - from and to is the start and end time for this dataset in the output.

The value to this parameter is on the form:
value="name=outname;nextrun=hh:mm,hh:mm"
Where - outname is the value to the name attribute. - nextrun is a comma separated list of times when there is expected that new data is available.

Each respond is given an HTTP expire time that is time of the next hour. The expire_rand value add some randomization to the expire time. The value is given as seconds and is the upper limit on the random addition to the expire value, ie. the addition will be in the range [0, expire_rand_value>.
Provider priority specifies the order the provider is requested from the wdb database. This parameter drives the generation of the xml output.
Key/value list.

If the topografi to be used is not in the dataset of this provider use the provider specified with this parameter. The parameter is on the form.
id="model_topo_provider-providername" value="topo_provider"
This means that for the provider with 'providername' use topologi data from the provider 'topo_provider'.
The topologi field give the hight in the model where the temparature is computed. This must be adjusted to the real hight of the requested location.

The real hight may come in as the alt parameter in the request or be loaded from a hight field with much higher resolution than what is used in the computer model. This high resolution field is given with the 'topo_provider' parameter.
The providername of a high resolution topologi field to use.
At the moment the miSymbol generator is used to generate shorthand symbols. This parameter gives the location of the configuration of miSymbol.
Key/value list.

This parameter configure how the request of the symbol generator (symbolMaker) shall be performed. For each point in time the generator is called to generate a symbol for this time. We need to specify how many hours around this time should been taking into account in the calculation.

The values is given as space separated list of values on the form:
value="(timespan,before,after) (timespan,before,after) ..."
Where - timespan is the timeperiod of the sybol. - before, the number of hours before the time point to take into account. - after, the number of hours after the time point to take into account.

refsect2.title: XML parameters and parameter setup
refsect2.para: To each XML parameter is it associated at least one paramdef. The id's that is defined and which XML tag it is associated with is given in the following tables.

In the first table is all ids for a deterministic weather forecast, in the second table is the additional ids for the simple probability forecast and in the last table is the ids for the advanced probability forecast.

refsect3.title: Deterministic forecast
refsect3.para: This is the normal deterministic parameters used in the weather forecast. It is used alone for the short term (48 hours) forecast.

listitem.para: T.2M, T.2M.LAND
WIND.U10M, WIND.V10M
RH.2M
MSLP
TOTAL.CLOUD
FOG
LOW.CLOUD
MEDIUM.CLOUD
HIGH.CLOUD
PRECIP.ACCUMULATED, PRECIP.1H
Symbols may be created in two ways. Either as a algorithmic compilation of precipitation, temperature and cloudiness (symbolMaker) or there is a symbol parameter in the data set.
Use id's: PRECIP.ACCUMULATED or PRECIP.1H, TOTAL.CLOUD, T.2M or T.2M.LAND: It may also use THUNDER.PROBABILITY and FOG.PROBABILITY to assign thunder and fog to the symbol.
THUNDER.PROBABILITY and FOG.PROBABILITY is given as on/off values. 0 is off and 1 is on.
SYMBOL

refsect3.title: Simple probability forecast
refsect3.para: In a simple probability forecast may all parameters for the deterministic forecast be used, but the following parameters is added.

The probability values is given as codes according to the table below.
Value | Code ------------+------ [90%,100% ] | 0 [60%, 90%> | 1 [0%, 60%> | 2

listitem.para:
The temperature probability depends on the temperature value according to the following table.
Temperature | ID -------------------------------+-------------------------- <-99.0,-20.0> | T.2M.PROBABILITY.4 [-20.0, -10.0> or [25.0, 99.0> | T.2M.PROBABILITY.3 [-10.0, -2.0> or [2.0,25.0> | T.2M.PROBABILITY.2 [-2.0, 2.0> | T.2M.PROBABILITY.1
Probability, WIND.PROBABILITY, associated with the wind parameters WIND.U10M and WIND.V10M. This is, in some way, the probability to both the speed and direction.
Probability, SYMBOL.PROBABILITY, associated with the id SYMBOL.

refsect3.title: Advanced probability forecast
refsect3.para:
The advanced probability forecast contains percentile data. The data is coded in the probability tag and has the general form.
<probability type="type" parameter="name" percentile="percentile" unit="parameterunit" value="value"/>
where - type is exact or lowerlimit. - percentile type=exact: 10, 25, 50, 75 or 90 type=lowerlimit: 0.1mm, 0.2mm, 0.5mm, 1.0mm, 2.0mm or 5.0mm. - parameter is temperature or precipitation. - unit is celcius, mm or percent.
The advanced probability forecast may contain all parameters from the deterministic and simple probability forecast. In addition to the probability tag.
In the table below is the coding

para.programlisting:
type=exact unit=celcius
percentile | id -----------+-------------------- 10 | T.2M.PERCENTILE.10 25 | T.2M.PERCENTILE.25 50 | T.2M.PERCENTILE.50 75 | T.2M.PERCENTILE.75 90 | T.2M.PERCENTILE.90

type=exact unit=mm percentile | id -----------+-------------------- 10 | PRECIP.PERCENTILE.10 25 | PRECIP.PERCENTILE.25 50 | PRECIP.PERCENTILE.50 75 | PRECIP.PERCENTILE.75 90 | PRECIP.PERCENTILE.90
type=lowerlimit unit=percent percentile | id -----------+-------------------- 0.1mm | PRECIP.PROBABILITY.0,1MM 0.2mm | PRECIP.PROBABILITY.0,2MM 0.5mm | PRECIP.PROBABILITY.0,5MM 1.0mm | PRECIP.PROBABILITY.1,0MM 2.0mm | PRECIP.PROBABILITY.2,0MM 5.0mm | PRECIP.PROBABILITY.5,0MM
